name: quick-image-convert
description: VSCode extension for quick image conversion and optimization.

quick-image-convert.avif.quality.description: Avif image quality. Higher values result in better quality but larger file sizes.

quick-image-convert.avif.lossless.description: When enabled, the Avif image will be lossless. This will result in a larger file size but better quality.

quick-image-convert.avif.effort.description: Avif image encoding effort. Higher values result in better quality but longer encoding times.

quick-image-convert.avif.chromaSubsampli.description: Avif image chroma subsampling. Higher values result in better quality but larger file sizes.

quick-image-convert.avif.bitdepth.description: Avif image bit depth. Higher values result in better quality but larger file sizes.

quick-image-convert.avif.useDefaultValue.description: When enabled, the default values for the Avif conversion will be used. When disabled, the user will be prompted to enter the values.

quick-image-convert.webp.quality.description: Webp image quality. Higher values result in better quality but larger file sizes.

quick-image-convert.webp.alphaQuality.description: Webp image alpha quality. Higher values result in better quality but larger file sizes.

quick-image-convert.webp.lossless.description: When enabled, the Webp image will be lossless. This will result in a larger file size but better quality.

quick-image-convert.webp.nearLossless.description: When enabled, the Webp image will be near lossless. This will result in a larger file size but better quality.

quick-image-convert.webp.smartSubsample.description: When enabled, the Webp image will use smart subsampling. This will result in a smaller file size but lower quality.

quick-image-convert.webp.effort.description: Webp image encoding effort. Higher values result in better quality but longer encoding times.

quick-image-convert.webp.minSize.description: When enabled, the Webp image will be optimized for minimum size. This will result in a smaller file size but lower quality.

quick-image-convert.webp.mixed.description: When enabled, the Webp image will use mixed compression. This will result in a smaller file size but lower quality.

quick-image-convert.webp.preset.description: Webp image preset. Higher values result in better quality but larger file sizes.

quick-image-convert.webp.useDefaultValue.description: When enabled, the default values for the Avif conversion will be used. When disabled, the user will be prompted to enter the values.

quick-image-convert.resize.fit.description: Resize fit. Determines how the image should be resized to fit the dimensions provided.

quick-image-convert.resize.position.description: Resize position. Determines where the image should be positioned when resizing.

quick-image-convert.resize.kernel.description: Resize kernel. Determines the algorithm used to resize the image.

quick-image-convert.resize.withoutEnlarg.description: When enabled, the image will not be enlarged if the dimensions provided are larger than the original image.

quick-image-convert.resize.withoutReduct.description: When enabled, the image will not be reduced if the dimensions provided are smaller than the original image.

quick-image-convert.resize.fastShrinkOnL.description: When enabled, the image will be resized quickly when loaded.

scripts.compile: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
